message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD). Among the options, Escitalopram is an antidepressant that is FDA-approved for the treatment of PTSD. Bupropion is used for depression and smoking cessation, not for PTSD. Buspirone is an anxiolytic medication, but it is not FDA-approved for the treatment of PTSD. Clonazepam is also an anxiolytic medication, but high doses may increase the risk of suicidal ideation so it is not the best initial treatment for this patient.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is experiencing symptoms of post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), which include insomnia, irritability, and flashbacks. Among the options, Escitalopram is an SSRI that can be used to treat PTSD. Bupropion, Buspirone, and Clonazepam are not first-line treatments for PTSD.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest that he has post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), especially with the strong memories of events that occurred with his fellow soldiers while at war. Among the options, Escitalopram is the best initial medical therapy for this patient as it is an antidepressant that is also FDA-approved to treat generalized anxiety disorder and PTSD. Bupropion is an antidepressant that is not typically used for anxiety disorders. Buspirone is an anxiolytic medication that is not FDA-approved to treat PTSD. Clonazepam is a benzodiazepine that is sometimes used to treat anxiety and PTSD but should not be the best initial therapy due to its risks of dependence, tolerance, and withdrawal.

Among the options, Escitalopram is a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI), which is used to treat anxiety and PTSD. Bupropion is used for depression and smoking cessation. Buspirone is an anti-anxiety medication. Clonazepam is a benzodiazepine, which is not recommended for use in elderly patients due to an increased risk of adverse effects.
